speaker: Skyline
text: A cloud appears and sprinkles rain._   [_N.B. The first scene of Act One has Frasier telling a story to Niles in the apartment, constantly interrupted by flashbacks and alternative versions of said flashbacks.  To preserve continuity, scenes that take place in a single setting over a continuous time have been named as a single scene in several parts: "1a, 1b, etc."_] _Scene 1-a - Frasier's apartment It is stormy outside and Frasier is fretting about something, pacing nervously.  The doorbell rings, and he rushes to admit Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_frantically_] Oh, Niles!  Thank God you've come quickly. I've been going mad.

speaker: Niles
text: This better be a real emergency, Frasier.  You pulled me away from the Gifted Infants Toy Expo.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, you missed out on buying a Tickle Me Tolstoy doll. Niles, my problem is more important than that.  You see, I've... [_desperately_] oh, dear God.  Niles, I've committed a crime!

speaker: Niles
text: Don't tell me.  You forgot to send the opera board a thank you note for the Christmas brickle.

speaker: Frasier
text: By God, man, it's a real crime!  Punishable by law!

speaker: Niles
text: By law?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of the United States of America.

speaker: Niles
text: Good heavens, what have you done?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll tell you.  But before you judge me, Niles, please, remember how much stress I've been under lately.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course.  Tell me everything, leave nothing out.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  It was a dark and stormy day...

speaker: Niles
text: You can leave that out.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  It was an average day, marred only by a persistent cough caused by a barista's over-nutmegging my machiatto. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 2 -- KACL Frasier is taking a call._

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead, Babette, what can I do for you?

speaker: Babette
text: [_v.o._] Well, Dr. Crane.  For about a year now, I've been stealing.  I get these uncontrollable urges to take things.

speaker: Frasier
text: Such as? [_He begins to cough and try to stifle it._]

speaker: Babette
text: All kinds of things.  Magazines from stores, a friend's sunglasses... things I don't even want.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see, um... [_clearing his throat_] Go on.

speaker: Babette
text: It's so unlike me.  I mean, my friends think I'm dull.  They all say "Babette, you're like an old shoe."  But stealing is so exciting.  It's really the only time I feel alive.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it sound to me like you have a classic case of klepto... [_wheezing cough, strained_] klepto...

speaker: Roz
text: Kleptomania.  Hi, Babette, this is Roz.  And if Dr. Crane weren't hacking up a hairball, I'm sure he would tell you that this thrill you get from stealing makes up for an emptiness in your life. _Frasier drinks from a water bottle, gesturing his approval for what Roz is saying._

speaker: Roz
text: That's the problem you really need to address.  So you should seek counseling, or at least find a support group.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and may I add...

speaker: Roz
text: She's gone and we're out of time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well then, this is Dr. Frasier Crane saying "Good day, Seattle," and "Good mental health."   [_N.B. Helen Mirren, a self-proclaimed huge fan of_ Frasier _, has the honor of being the show's last guest caller._]

speaker: Roz
text: Are you okay?  I haven't heard so much coughing since I was backstage at Reggae Sunsplash.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... [_clears throat_] ...I'm fine, Roz, thank you.  Thank you so much.  Your advice was spot on.

speaker: Roz
text: It should be.  I've heard you say the same stuff for ten years now.  "Confront your emotions," "communicate," "seek counseling."

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't realize my advice had become so predictable.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it's not your fault everyone calls with the same dumb-ass problems.

speaker: Frasier
text: They're not the same problems.  What about that--that caller last week, the sleepwalking transvestite who kept breaking off his heels in sewer grates?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I remember him.  You told him to seek counseling.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_indignant_] Yes, I also told him to wear flats.  Oh, oh, did maintenance remember to bring me that hammer I asked for?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah, right here. [_She grabs a hammer._] What do you need it for?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking the hammer_] Some imbecile's been parking in my spot despite several strongly worded notes I have left on his windshield.  The time has come for me to take matters into my own hands.

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] My God, Frasier, so that's what you did! _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-b - Frasier's apartment Cut back to Frasier's narrative to Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: In an uncontrollable rage over the commandeering of your parking space, you took hammer to car! _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 3-a - Parking garage Niles's line continues as a voiceover here.  Frasier approaches a car..._

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] You are a _vandal_! _And angrily smashes in the windshield and hood with the hammer.  SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-c - Frasier's apartment Frasier corrects Niles's conclusion._

speaker: Frasier
text: It was nothing like that! _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 3-b - Parking garage Frasier's narrative continues as a voiceover._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] My "Reserved" sign was a-dangle.  I used the hammer to tack it back on.

speaker: Willa
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I-I didn't realize this spot was reserved.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angrily_] So all those notes that I left... [_seeing her_] must have... blown away.  [_shaking her hand_] Uh, I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Willa
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you know my show?

speaker: Willa
text: It's on your sign.  Willa Haver.  I'm so sorry.  My assigned spot is on the roof, and with the rain and everything...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no it's perfectly understandable, and now that I know that this is your Audi, let me be the first to say [_grinning_] "Audi, neighbor!" _CUT TO:  Scene 1-d - Back to the Frasier/Niles narrative in the apartment._

speaker: Niles
text: And that's when she took the hammer and put you out of your misery?

speaker: Frasier
text: That would have been preferable. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 3-c - Parking garage Back to Frasier's conversation with the woman._ _

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, perhaps in the spirit of detente, I could, uh, buy you some coffee?

speaker: Willa
text: Oh, well, that is so sweet of you, but I can't right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, perhaps tomorrow?

speaker: Willa
text: Uh, no tomorrow's no good either.

speaker: Frasier
text: Next week, perhaps?

speaker: Willa
text: Next week, uh, I'll be out of town.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm-I'm not sure if we're having a devil of a time coordinating our schedules or you're just giving me a polite brush-off.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as she gets in her car, dejectedly_] OK, now I'm sure.   **HOW TO DEAL WITH A DIM BULB**  _Scene 1-e -- Frasier's apartment Fade in.  Back to Frasier's narrative to Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: My morning's travails aside, Niles, you'll be happy to know I didn't strike out with every woman I encountered today. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 4-a - Hallway near the elevator An elderly woman approaches as Frasier goes to enter his apartment._  [_N.B. Estelle Parsons has already "appeared" this season, as a guest caller in[[11.12]](/frasier/transcripts/season_11/episode_12/frasier_lite.html "Frasier-Lite"), "Frasier-Lite."_]

speaker: Opal
text: Frasier.  I heard the elevator, and I thought, "I bet that's Frasier," and it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: How are you, Mrs. Magrini?

speaker: Opal
text: Oh, just grand, and how many times do I have to ask you to call me Opal?  You make me feel like an old woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_uncomfortably_] Opal, then.  Lovely to see you again.

speaker: Opal
text: [_not taking his strong hints_] Some weather!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_patiently_] Yes, it's just awful.

speaker: Opal
text: Oh!  It's blowing a gale.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's quite a storm.

speaker: Opal
text: And colder than a well-digger's wallet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's quite apt.

speaker: Opal
text: I wonder if I could ask a favor.

speaker: Opal
text: I know you're probably as busy as an ant farm, but do you think you could change a light bulb for me?  The last time I tried, I fell off the ladder, and I lay on my back like...

speaker: Frasier
text: Like a helpless turtle?

speaker: Opal
text: No, like a half-hour till the ambulance came.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nodding it off_] Well, uh, let me just get out of these wet shoes, and I'll be right over.

speaker: Opal
text: Oh, great.  I'll make some tea and cookies.  We always have such lively conversations.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_veiled sarcasm_] Yes, we're reviving a lost art. _Frasier enters his apartment, where Martin and Ronee are sitting on a couch, looking at photos.  Daphne is also there._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Martin
text: Some weather, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_irritated_] Yes, it's raining.  I've just gone over that with Mrs. Magrini.

speaker: Ronee
text: Hey, come look at these pictures from our engagement party.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, that camera you gave us is terrific.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, is that the camera I gave you ten years ago?  I can't believe you've never used it before.

speaker: Martin
text: Shows you what you know.  Turns out half the shots on this roll were taken the night you gave it to me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, come and look at these old pictures.

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] Yes, and then we all looked at the pictures! _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-f - Cut back to the Frasier/Niles narrative._

speaker: Niles
text: I remember it as if it were _four hours ago_.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am coming to my point! _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 4-b - Back to looking at the pictures._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Martin, look at you.  Sitting in your chair all sour and grumpy.

speaker: Ronee
text: You must be drunk in this picture, Niles.  You've got your arm around a floor lamp.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking the photo_] Oh, no, that's Maris in her Easter hat.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_showing Niles a photo_] Why are you all hunched over in this one?

speaker: Niles
text: [_uncomfortably_] Uh...

speaker: Daphne
text: You were looking at my bum, weren't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, heavens, no!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's all right, Niles, we're married now.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, yes.  I might once in a moment of weakness have permitted myself a fleeting glance.

speaker: Niles
text: Or twice.

speaker: Niles
text: [_giving in_] Many, many times.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's all about the rear with you, isn't it?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, darling...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_interrupting_] No, seriously...

speaker: Daphne
text: What color are my eyes?

speaker: Niles
text: [_uncomfortable_] Um...

speaker: Daphne
text: You're looking at it again, aren't you?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I...

speaker: Martin
text: [_nostalgically_] Boy, you look at these pictures, you can really see how far we've all come.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, I'll say, you were such an old sourpuss and [_to Niles_] you with the crypt keeper there, and [_to Frasier_] you... well, God, you haven't changed a bit.  You're even wearing the same jacket that you wore in this picture.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking at the photo_] Hardly the same, I've had it relined. _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-g - Back to the narrative._

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't mind telling you, Niles.  What happened next was particularly galling.

speaker: Niles
text: I remember exactly what happened, and I haven't got a clue what you're talking about. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 4-c - Cut back to the nostalgia session. Martin's arm is around Ronee._

speaker: Niles
text: [_peacefully_] Our lives are so complete.

speaker: Martin
text: [_contentedly_] We really are lucky. _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-h - Narrative_

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please, that's not how it happened at all! _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 4-d - Frasier's version Niles, Daphne, Martin, and Ronee are all staring pointedly at Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: [_Daphne in his arm, tauntingly_] Our lives are so complete!

speaker: Martin
text: [_nyah-nyah!_] We really are lucky!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, come on, Niles, we should be heading off to the baby show.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, right.

speaker: Daphne
text: If we're lucky, we might get a lead on a nanny.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well you know, there are ads in the back of that _Seattle Weekly_.

speaker: Ronee
text: Just make sure you look in the right section.  If she says she's got her own toys and is willing to spank, she may not be a nanny. _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-i - Narrative_

speaker: Niles
text: Don't tell me!  In your desperation over being the only Crane man not to find love, you picked up that paper and did the unthinkable! _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 5 - Fantasy of Frasier opening the door to a leather-clad call girl._

speaker: Frasier
text: Tawny LaRue, I presume. _SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-j - Narrative_

speaker: Frasier
text: I did no such thing, you nit! [_beating him with the paper_] And I am telling this story!

speaker: Niles
text: Very slowly!  I'm beginning to think you didn't do anything!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'm getting to it!  Now you'll recall, I promised to change my neighbor's light bulb.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, God... _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 6-a - Opal Magrini's apartment Brown tones, much antique furniture.  Frasier is perched on a ladder by some high shelves.  Opal enters with a plate of cookies._

speaker: Opal
text: Here we are!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking at a statue_] I was just admiring your bust.

speaker: Opal
text: [_taking "bust" differently_] Thank you!

speaker: Frasier
text: It might look nice a little higher.

speaker: Opal
text: It might look nice a lot higher, but heck, I'm 83.  Anyway, I can't thank you enough for coming to my rescue.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's lucky you ran into me in the hall.

speaker: Opal
text: Oh, I knew that would be you coming out of the elevator.  If there's one thing I can count on, it's old Frasier's routine, unchanging as Granddad's whiskers.

speaker: Opal
text: There's old Frasier off to work.  There's old Frasier coming home.  There's old Frasier off to work.  There's old Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, "old Frasier" gets the idea.

speaker: Opal
text: That's why I gave you my spare key.  I knew if there was ever an emergency, I could count on you.  Oh, we should have our tea. My date's picking me up in twenty minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: How marvelous you're still dating.

speaker: Opal
text: Well, I think an active social life keeps you young.  So what are you doing this evening?

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought I'd stay in with a good book.

speaker: Opal
text: [_with a patronizing smile_] Ah, isn't that nice?  How you're so cozy in your routine.  Ha ha, you're like an old shoe, Frasier. _She taps his leg and walks away.  SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-k - Narrative_

speaker: Frasier
text: [_haunted_] That's when I snapped!

speaker: Niles
text: You didn't!  You bludgeoned her horribly with that bust! _CUT TO:  Scene 6-b - Fantasy shot of Frasier threatening Opal with the bust from the ladder and her cowering in fear.  SMASH CUT TO:  Scene 1-l - Narrative_

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you insane twit! _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 6-c - Continuation of the scene._

speaker: Opal
text: You're like an old shoe, Frasier, now come have some tea.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o. from his conversation with Niles_] I suddenly flashed on my caller, Babette.  Before I knew what I was doing, I impulsively pocketed something that belonged to her. _We see Frasier surreptitiously grabbing a small square box from the shelf as Opal prepares the tea._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o., haunted, menacingly_] I _stole_ , Niles!  Like some craven thief.  And I've never felt more _alive_! _Frasier's face as he perpetrates the act is wild with menace. A thunderclap as he pockets the box.  He walks to join Opal, who saw nothing, for tea.  FADE OUT.  END OF ACT I  ACT II_ [_N.B. Frasier's story completed, we now return to a normal order of scenes._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't imagine the thrill I felt as I sat there sipping her inferior tea and eating her excellent cookies, all the while fingering the stolen object in my pocket.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_again with the menacing tone_] And then how coolly I walked out, scot-free, the old bird none the wiser.

speaker: Niles
text: What's in there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Some sort of decorative medallion.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's pretty clear what happened.  The depressing series of events today led you to conclude that you're in a rut. Your spontaneous transgression generated the excitement that you so desperately wanted.

speaker: Frasier
text: Any Caribbean-trained Psych student could tell me that!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if you didn't want my diagnosis, why did you call me here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because I am plagued by guilt.  I have to return this box before it's discovered missing.

speaker: Niles
text: [_wary_] Why did you call me here?

speaker: Frasier
text: I need your help, Niles.  I have her key.  I know she's out. We can put this back and be done with it.

speaker: Niles
text: But I don't want to.  I have excitement in my life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please!  I can't trust myself to be alone.  I am caught in the grip of this mania!  Who knows what I might steal next?

speaker: Niles
text: You took a little box!  I hardly think you're going to run off on a crime spree.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really? _He produces Niles's handkerchief.  Shocked, Niles checks his pocket and finds it empty._

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising_] Thief!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_menacing again_] That's right!  I took it, and I liked it! [_pleading_] Please, please, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: I don't want to get involved.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, I'll do it myself.  Here, hold this for me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes it_] Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_snatches it back_] Now your prints are on it, too.  You have to help me!

speaker: Niles
text: Fiend! _Frasier runs out the door, chased by Niles, who quickly grabs his coat. FADE OUT.  Scene 8 - The Magrini apartment Frasier and Niles enter.  It is dark._

speaker: Frasier
text: Admit it, Niles.  It's intoxicating, isn't it?  Don't you feel the tingle running down your spine?

speaker: Niles
text: In a minute, it's going to be running down my inseam, hurry up.

speaker: Frasier
text: I've become a danger junkie.  A cunning cat burglar with nerves of steel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hide!  Hide!  Here, here, take this box!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no you've got a pocket.

speaker: Frasier
text: Put it... _They frantically rush out to a balcony, which is hidden by curtains, as a group of people enter the apartment.  Leading them are Opal's imposing son, Roland, and her niece, Sarah._

speaker: Roland
text: All right.  All right, everybody.  Put down your gifts, give me your coats and I'll put them in the bedroom.

speaker: Sarah
text: Hello?  Thank you!  Okay, that was the doorman.  Aunt Opal is on her way up!  Everyone find a place to hide!

speaker: Sarah
text: All right, quiet everybody!  I hear them! _Opal enters with her date.  The lights come on and they all jump out and shout "Surprise!"  Frasier and Niles, with no other option, join the surprise shouts and emerge from the balcony._

speaker: Opal
text: Oh, my goodness! Thank you!

speaker: Opal
text: [_seeing the Cranes_] Frasier!

speaker: Sarah
text: Who are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm Dr. Frasier Crane, the next door neighbor, uh, and this is my brother Niles, uh, we just wanted to say Happy Birthday, Opal!

speaker: Opal
text: Thank you!

speaker: Roland
text: Did someone invite you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quick on his feet_] Uh, well, the news of this birthday has been just buzzing through the building.  We wouldn't miss an opportunity to honor this wonderful lady.

speaker: Roland
text: Then how'd you get in here?

speaker: Frasier
text: We slipped in as the door was closing.

speaker: Roland
text: I could swear...

speaker: Opal
text: Stop grilling them, please, Roland!  He thinks he has to grill everyone just because he's a district attorney.

speaker: Opal
text: Now, what would you like to drink? [_N.B. Janelle is played by Bernadette Birkett, the real-life wife of George Wendt, who played Norm Peterson on "Cheers."  She played the voice of Norm's wife Vera on several occasions, and appeared in the third season episode "Fairy Tales Can Come True" as Tinker Bell._]

speaker: Janelle
text: Champagne!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, we really can't stay.

speaker: Opal
text: Oh, you can stay a few minutes.  You don't want to hurt my feelings.

speaker: Janelle
text: [_to Niles_] Here, let me take your coat.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my coat, no, I'd really rather you... [_it's too late, as she has removed the coat_] Uh, okay.

speaker: Janelle
text: [_holding the coat_] Oh, my God!

speaker: Niles
text: What, what?

speaker: Janelle
text: You're Dr. Frasier Crane!

speaker: Janelle
text: Here, take this, Roland.  I love your show!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh...

speaker: Janelle
text: It's going to be so exciting to have a celebrity here when we take Aunt Opal's picture with her medal!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: [_frightened_] Medal?!

speaker: Janelle
text: She won the bronze at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Janelle
text: So what's it like being a huge radio star?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_always making time for a fan_] Well...

speaker: Niles
text: [_subdued panic_] Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, in a minute, Niles.  Actually, I don't really think of myself as a star so much as a healer.  The important thing is to listen...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, not now, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_with feigned excitement and deeper meaning_] Frasier, they're going to take her picture with her medal!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I heard that. [_then, he really DOES hear it_] Oh, dear.  Uh, excuse me just a moment.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_under his breath_] You have got to get that medal out of your coat.

speaker: Niles
text: Why don't you get it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm a celebrity.  They're watching my every move.  Go on.

speaker: Sarah
text: Aunt Opal, tell Dr. Crane the story about how you refused to shake Hitler's hand when he gave you that medal.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!

speaker: Opal
text: It looked sweaty, that's all. _They all laugh.  CUT TO: Niles entering the bedroom.  Unfortunately, another elderly woman (Florence) is napping on top of the coats.  She stirs a little.  Niles tries to extract his coat without waking her, but he drags her with it. She awakens, with Niles's face a few inches from hers._

speaker: Florence
text: Who are you?

speaker: Niles
text: It's just a dream.

speaker: Florence
text: Then why aren't you Harry Truman?

speaker: Opal
text: Where's my cake?  I'm ready for the cake!

speaker: Roland
text: No, not until we take the family picture, Mother.

speaker: Niles
text: [_softly, to Frasier_] I got it.

speaker: Opal
text: Well, then let's take the darned picture.  Roland, get my medal down.

speaker: Roland
text: Where is it?

speaker: Opal
text: Same place it always is, unless it's grown legs like a tadpole and hopped away.

speaker: Frasier
text: We have got to get that medal up there!

speaker: Niles
text: What do you mean "we?"

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.  Bad plan.  You've got to get it up there.  All right, top shelf, right of the sconce.  [_to the guests_] You know, before we take the picture, I have a little story I'd like to tell that just may rival that Hitler tale. _They all divert their attention to Frasier.  Niles makes sure nobody is looking before he ascends the ladder._

speaker: Frasier
text: The place...was right here.  The time...was this afternoon. Opal had just set out a lovely service of tea and a plate of sweets.  I remember there were three cookies sitting on the plate, and I reached for... [_with meaning_] the LEFT one.  Not the CENTER one, the LEFT one, and just at the same moment, Opal reached for the very same cookie, and, oh, what did you say? Oh, it was priceless.

speaker: Opal
text: I said, "You take it."

speaker: Frasier
text: Hah!  Right off the top of her head.

speaker: Roland
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: I, uh...

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, I can tell from the panic in my brother's voice that he must have seen a spider.  You see, he has a crippling fear of spiders, and it sent him up the ladder.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I hate spiders.

speaker: Sarah
text: I didn't see a spider.  Come back down.

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Roland
text: Why not?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because he also has a crippling fear of heights.  This may be just the breakthrough we've been looking for.  Higher, Niles! Conquer your fear!

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, everyone, I'm going to have to ask you to turn around, as his fear of crowds has set in.

speaker: Sarah
text: Crowds, too?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you are looking at that rarest of beasts, the arachno-acro- agoraphobe.  Please, avert your eyes.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is the most difficult part of the process.  I am using a technique known as behavioral exposure therapy.  Climb higher, Niles.  Ever higher, conquer your fear!

speaker: Janelle
text: Wow, Frasier Crane in action!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, please, no peeking!  You don't want to cause a setback.  After replacing the medal, Niles slips off the ladder and hangs from the top shelf by his fingertips.  Frasier stifles a scream. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Everybody freeze!  This is the moment of truth.  I haven't done this since my days in med school. _He motions for them to keep looking away.  He then rescues Niles by climbing under him.  Niles is now seated on Frasier's shoulders and releases the bookshelf.  Everybody sees Frasier carrying Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hurrah!  He's done it!  He's conquered all three!

speaker: Opal
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you as an athlete should know the time-honored tradition of hoisting the victor on one's shoulders.

speaker: Opal
text: They never did that to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you finished third, didn't you?  Now if you'll excuse me. I've got to journal all this while it's still fresh.  Good night, everyone! _He walks toward the door.  As he exits, Niles's head bumps on the top of the doorway.  Everybody gasps with concern._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  Good Lord, I should have dipped.  I tell you... _On the second attempt, Niles bumps his head again.  They fumble out the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: So sorry. _Having made their not so graceful exit from the party, Frasier and Niles have apparently successfully concealed the crime.  FADE OUT._ **OEDIPAL UNDIES** _Scene 9 - Frasier's apartment Frasier is on the couch looking at the old photos.  Martin enters in his robe rom the back._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hey, Dad, I didn't know you guys were here.  Where's Ronee?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, she's in bed waiting for me.  Hey, Fras, you know what, she can't see a thing without her contacts.  Why don't we play a little joke on her?  You tiptoe in...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, I'll pass.

speaker: Martin
text: Still looking at those old pictures, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: It's funny, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: How suddenly your whole life can change.  I never would've dreamed back then that I'd end up getting married again, at my age, and to someone so young and full of pep.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm very happy for you and Ronee.

speaker: Martin
text: That's the way it is.  Just when you think that you're in a rut, and nothing exciting will ever happen to you again, Pow!  That's when it does.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe you're right.

speaker: Martin
text: I know I'm right.  Good night, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good night, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, you could put on my robe and a little bit of my Aqua Velva...

speaker: Frasier
text: Good night, Dad. [_N.B. This last scene is certainly a foreshadowing of the next episode,[[11.18]](/frasier/transcripts/season_11/episode_18/match_game.html "Match Game") "Match Game." - which might explain why "Match Game" was not aired until several weeks after it was filmed._]
